etri.sdn.controller

Class OFController

  • java.lang.Object
    • etri.sdn.controller.OFController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOFHandler, java.lang.Comparable<IOFHandler>

    public abstract class OFController
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOFHandler, java.lang.Comparable<IOFHandler>
    Mother of all OpenFlow controller implementations.
    Author:
    bjlee

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  OFController.QI
      Queue Item
      private class  OFController.QP
      Queue Item Processor, which is a thread that pulls QI object from the queue that is associated with the thread.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface etri.sdn.controller.protocol.io.IOFHandler

        IOFHandler.Role

    • Constructor Detail

      • OFController

        public OFController(int num_of_queue,
            java.lang.String role)
        OFController constructor.
        Parameters:
        num_of_queue - number of Queue Item Processors

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public abstract void init()
        Every controller implementation that inherits OFController should implement this function to handle all the chores related to the controller initialization. You can use SimpleOFController class as a reference to see what kind of initialization you should do.

      • getRole

        public IOFHandler.Role getRole()
        get the role of this controller. But currently, the return value of this function only set to MASTER.
        Specified by:
        getRole in interface IOFHandler

      • registerProtocolServer

        public void registerProtocolServer(IOFProtocolServer server)
        Register a protocol server that actually handles the underlying bearer protocol.
        Specified by:
        registerProtocolServer in interface IOFHandler

      • removeSelf

        public void removeSelf()
        This method is called by OFController.QP.run() when a controller fails to remove itself from the protocol server, which prevents this controller from receiving other Openflow messages from the protocol server.

      • shutdown

        public void shutdown()
        Shutdown this OF Controller instance including all the Queue Processors

      • start

        public void start()
        Start all Queue Processors.

      • scheduleTask

        public void scheduleTask(IOFTask task,
                long after)
        Schedule a task to be executed after 'after'. Unless the task.execute() returns false, the task periodically repeated using 'after' as a period value.
        Specified by:
        scheduleTask in interface IOFHandler
        Parameters:
        task -
        time - millisecond since Epoch
        after - re-schedule this task after 'after' milliseconds. If zero is given, the task will start immediately, and never be repeated.

      • handleConnectedEvent

        public final boolean handleConnectedEvent(Connection conn)
        This callback is called when a new connection to a new switch is made.
        Specified by:
        handleConnectedEvent in interface IOFHandler

                     MessageContext context,
                     org.openflow.protocol.OFPacketIn m)
        handle Packet-in Message.
        Parameters:
        conn - underlying connection
        context -
        m - Packet-in message.
        Returns:

      • handleGeneric

        public abstract boolean handleGeneric(Connection conn,
                    MessageContext context,
                    org.openflow.protocol.OFMessage m)
        handle the other messages.
        Parameters:
        conn - underlying connection
        context -
        m - message which is not packet-in, hello, or echo request message.
        Returns:
        returns false when the underling connection caused error.

      • isMySwitch

        public boolean isMySwitch(Connection conn)
        This function returns true if a given switch is assigned to this controller. But this function is not used currently, so should be removed from the source.

      • addModule

        public final void addModule(OFModule module)
        This method is automatically called by OFModule.init(IOFHandler). This method is for adding a module as a part of this controller object.
        Specified by:
        addModule in interface IOFHandler

      • compareTo

        public final int compareTo(IOFHandler o)
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<IOFHandler>

      • getModels

        public final OFModel[] getModels()
        This method returns all the OFModel object which are associated with this controller. As an OFModel object is normally associated with a OFModule object, this method calls OFModule.getModels() method of each OFModule object in modules.
        Specified by:
        getModels in interface IOFHandler
